title: SPACK_SHELL set incorrectly within cobalt scheduler job script environment
body:
I have been unable to get any spack load commands to work within a cobalt job script even though they work fine on a login node or within an interactive job session.  This is on the "cooley" system at the ALCF (https://www.alcf.anl.gov/user-guides/cooley).

After some debugging, I found that this is because the SPACK_SHELL variable is being set incorrectly.  This is in my env after running setup-env.sh:

```SPACK_SHELL=margo-regressio```

("margo-regressio" is a truncation of the actual script name).  The SPACK_SHELL variable is generated from this logic:

https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/share/spack/setup-env.sh#L201

If I check the output of ```ps -p $$``` within a job script, I get the following:

```
ps -p 106371
   PID TTY          TIME CMD
106371 ?        00:00:00 margo-regressio
```

Note that the CMD is "margo-regressio" intead of "bash" like the setup-env.sh logic expects.  If I manually edit setup-env.sh to force SPACK_SHELL to be set to "bash", then everything works as expected for me.

Is there a more robust way to detect the shell type in setup-env.sh, or maybe even just a way to override it from the command line?
